R

read() - Method in class IOconsole
 
read() - Method in interface IOInterface
Used to read the user input to the batterbot.
read() - Method in class IOSocket
 
response - Variable in class ResponseTemplate
This is an array of strings that form the parts of the response delimited by words that need to be filled in.
ResponseBuilder - Class in <Unnamed>
Given a Response Template as input, the Response Builder fills in the canned sentence with its variable substitutions and returns the response as a string.
ResponseBuilder() - Constructor for class ResponseBuilder
 
ResponseBuilderInterface - Interface in <Unnamed>
Interface to define the method signatures of the ResponseBuilder.
responses - Static variable in interface SharedData
The Hash-table data structure containing pointers to all of the response templates.
ResponseSelector - Class in <Unnamed>
The Response Selector contains a reference to a Hash Table storing pointers to all of the Response Templates.
ResponseSelector() - Constructor for class ResponseSelector
 
ResponseSelectorInterface - Interface in <Unnamed>
This interface sets up the method signatures for the response selector component.
ResponseTemplate - Class in <Unnamed>
This class is used to store "canned" sentences and their variable substitutions.
ResponseTemplate(String[], String[][], String[], String) - Constructor for class ResponseTemplate
Constructor to build a response template.
ResponseTemplate(String[], String[][], String[]) - Constructor for class ResponseTemplate
Constructor to build a response template.
ResponseTemplateInterface - Interface in <Unnamed>
This class is made up of response string arrays, and word bucket lists Here is an example of a response template: "Are you feeling _______? I am feeling __________." then the response would be stored as: response = {"Are you feeling ", "? I am feeling ", "."}; This is an example of a possible corresponding word bucket: blanks = {{"happy", "sad", "lonely", "angry", "amused", "bored"}, {"happy", "sad", "lonely", "angry", "amused", "bored"}}; Where the first array corresponds to a list of words which can be used to fill in the first blank in the response template, and similarly the second array is a list of words that can be used to fill in the second blank in the response template.
